tourName: Bajío tailor made holiday in Mexico
generalInfo:
Welcome to Mexico, a land of vibrant traditions, breathtaking landscapes, and deep-rooted history. From ancient civilizations to colonial charm and modern creativity, this country offers a rich mosaic of experiences waiting to be discovered.

Whether you're here to explore archaeological wonders, savor world-renowned cuisine, or connect with the warmth of its people, Mexico invites you to slow down, open your senses, and embrace every moment.

We’re delighted to accompany you on this journey. Let the colors, flavors, and stories of Mexico inspire you, this is just the beginning.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Mexico City, the capital and largest city in Mexico, recognized for its rich history and culture that blends pre-Hispanic, colonial, and contemporary influences to offer travelers an endless array of places to explore and a vibrant, diverse gastronomy. Upon arrival, you will be transferred to your hotel, Casa González, a charming and peaceful retreat nestled in one of the city’s most emblematic neighborhoods. Settle in and get ready to begin your journey through this dynamic metropolis. included : Private simple transfer AICM - Hotel in CDMX - 2 bags 25 kg (Private Service) / 4 Nights at Mexico City: Casa González Standard Room - 1 king cama American breakfast

Mexico City is a vibrant and culturally rich city with a fascinating history dating back to pre-Columbian times. The city is famous for its impressive architecture, which includes ancient Aztec ruins and colonial-era buildings, as well as modern skyscrapers. The city is also home to numerous museums, art galleries and cultural centers that showcase Mexico's rich cultural heritage. Another highlight is its delicious cuisine, which ranges from tacos and tamales to haute cuisine restaurants. Your private transportation will pick you up to take you to the Historic Center of Mexico City, declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. At the meeting point your local English-speaking guide will be waiting for you to start a walking tour of approximately 4 hours through the streets of the Aztec capital. During this experience you will learn about the history and gastronomy of Mexico while visiting the most emblematic places of the historic center such as the Metropolitan Cathedral, the ruins of the ancient Aztec city, the Palace of Fine Arts and the Postal Palace, you will also make a few stops at local food stalls and restaurants that only your guide knows and taste traditional Mexican food including tacos and a dessert. You will understand why Mexican gastronomy is considered Intangible Cultural Heritage of the Community, at the end of the experience your transportation will take you back to your accommodation. included : Tortilla crawl: Life beyond tacos experience - 6h - ENG (Private Service) Transport, guide, tasting, dessert - 7:30am, 2pm

Today, you will visit Xochimilco on a 3-hour tour to learn about the pre-Hispanic agricultural system that still operates today: the Chinampas. With your local Spanish-speaking guide, you will head to the Xochimilco docks, which means Place of Flowers. This is a system of canals divided by small artificial islands called chinampas, declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1987. You will enjoy a two-hour ride (one hour each way) on a conventional trajinera. During the journey, your guide will share insights about the history of the canals, the endemic species, and the challenges involved in maintaining this ecosystem today. You will arrive at a chinampa covering just over 3 hectares, nestled in the Protected Natural Area Ejidos of Xochimilco and San Gregorio Atlapulco. There, you will receive a theoretical and practical explanation of the steps followed to produce a variety of vegetables. Later, you will tour the planting area, concluding with an explanation of the biofilter, which also serves as a refuge for the region’s iconic species: the Axolotl. After returning to the dock, your transportation will take you to the Casa Azul, the former home of Frida Kahlo, where you’ll explore her life, art, and legacy. You’ll then continue to the charming neighborhood of Coyoacán, known for its colonial architecture, bohemian atmosphere, and colorful plazas. Take time to stroll, enjoy a coffee, or visit local shops before heading back to your hotel. included : : Chinampa Olintlalli trans service, Coyo & C. Azul - 5h - ENG (Private Service) Roundtrip transport, translation service, trajinera, entrance Demonstrative Chinampa - 2h - SPA (Private Service) Conventional trajinera, guide - 9am to 3pm

Today you will have a guided tour of approximately 5 hours. First you will visit the Museum of Anthropology, one of the most important museums in Latin America and the world. It was built in the 1960s by architect Pedro Ramirez Vasquez and has 22 rooms designed to preserve Mexico's rich indigenous heritage. Accompanied by your English-speaking guide, you will tour the museum's main collections while learning about the history of pre-Hispanic cultures and appreciating some of the most important pieces of pre-Columbian Mexico such as the Aztec Calendar, the Olmec Colossal Head, and the famous Mask of Pakal. Your second stop of the day will be the majestic Chapultepec Castle surrounded by a forest of the same name, one of the largest green areas of the Aztec capital. You will start with a walk through the forest and then start climbing up to the castle located at the top of the hill. The castle was built in 1785 as the residence of the viceroy of New Spain and was later remodeled to be the home of Emperor Maximilian and Empress Carlota. In 1939 it became the National Museum of History with a magnificent collection of historical pieces and murals with interpretations of the history of Mexico. From the top there are beautiful views of the forest and the city. included : Anthropology Museum & Chapultepec Castle - 5 h - ENG (Private Service) Transport, guide, entrance

Today your English-speaking local guide will pick you up from your hotel and head out of Mexico City to the valley of Teotihuacan to begin your approximately 8-hour experience. Here, your guide will tell you about the meaning of the City of the Gods, while you walk along the Calzada de los Muertos, sharing the mysteries of this ancient civilization, where you will find buildings such as the Pyramid of the Sun and Pyramid of the Moon. Afterwards, you will board your transport for a tour of the Route of the Murals, an ancient natural observatory offering breathtaking views of Teotihuacan. You’ll close your day with a visit to the home of a family of artisans, where you’ll learn about the obsidian process and how it is transformed into handicrafts. You will also enjoy a tasting of pulque and products derived from xoconostle, a cactus fruit emblematic of the region. At the end of the designated time, you will enjoy a local lunch, and your transportation will continue on to San Miguel de Allende, where your tour will end and you will be dropped off at your accommodation. Hotel La Morada is located in the colonial city of San Miguel de Allende, just 20 steps away from the main square and surrounded by historical monuments, the best restaurants, shops, boutiques, and the wonderful streets of San Miguel. It offers simply decorated rooms with various amenities, including Wi-Fi, a coffee maker, and cable TV, among others. It is an excellent choice for travelers seeking a comfortable place to sleep and be in the heart of the historic center. included : Teotihuacán walking tour (Private Service) Transport, guide, entrance, lunch, drop off San Miguel / 3 Nights at San Miguel de Allende: La Morada Standard Room - 1 king cama American breakfast

Embark on a guided culinary tour lasting approximately 3 to 3.5 hours, designed to highlight the very best of San Miguel’s regional flavors. You’ll visit five carefully selected tasting spots, including family-run restaurants and local food stands, offering enough delicious samples to make up a satisfying lunch. Along the way, enjoy refreshing local beverages and learn about the community’s culinary traditions, its history, and the deep cultural ties that shape everyday life. Tastings include a traditional soup, a flavorful tortilla soup, mole enchiladas, tacos, ice cream, and the most famous churro in San Miguel. included : Downtown Food tour (Shared Service) Guide, tastings

San Miguel de Allende is a beautiful colonial city famous for its colonial architecture, vibrant artistic life and rich culture. The city was founded in the 16th century, and its historic center has been declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Highlights include the Parroquia de San Miguel Arcángel, an iconic church with its neo-Gothic towers, and the Jardín Principal, a beautiful public square surrounded by historic buildings. Another of San Miguel de Allende's attractions is its gastronomy, with a wide variety of restaurants offering traditional Mexican dishes and creative fusions. included : Historical urban walk - 2.5h - ENG (Private Service) Guide, water - 9am to 5pm

Guanajuato is a cultural and historical jewel in Mexico. Among the things you can do in the city are: Enjoy a delicious traditional meal in one of the restaurants surrounding the Juarez Theater. Climb to the viewpoint of the Monumento al Pípila for a panoramic view of the city. Explore the subway tunnels that run through Guanajuato and learn the history behind them. Lose yourself in the charm of the alleys of the historic center. Visit the iconic Alhóndiga de Granaditas, a place of historical importance in the struggle for Mexico's independence. Take a break in the tranquil Plaza de La Paz, surrounded by colonial buildings and a relaxed atmosphere. Today, you will be transferred from San Miguel de Allende to your hotel in Guanajuato. After settling in, your local English-speaking guide will meet you for a two-and-a-half-hour walking tour through the historic center of Guanajuato, one of Mexico’s most culturally rich cities and a former mining capital. This experience will take you through colorful streets, colonial buildings, and charming neighborhoods, revealing the city’s legends, traditions, and architectural beauty. As you walk, you’ll discover iconic sites such as the Callejón del Beso, a romantic alley that tells a tragic love story cherished by locals and visitors alike. Let the rooftops, alleys, and plazas of Guanajuato guide you through its vibrant past and present. included : San Miguel de Allende - Guanajuato - 1 h 28 min (Private Service) / 2 Nights at Guanajuato: Mesón de los Poetas Standard Single - 1 dbl cama Breakfast

Today, your local guide in English will take you on a two-and-a-half-hour tour through the first silver and gold mining center in the world par excellence: Guanajuato. Enjoy Guanajuato's mining past in a vehicle that will pick you up at your hotel and lead you to some of the most traditional mining neighborhoods in the city; you will learn about its history under the culture and landscape of the region. Also, you could look up to its former mining haciendas, subway streets, tunnels, and 600-meter mine shafts. In the end, visiting this World Heritage Site could bring you the opportunity to discover more about this mining center on your own or to continue your experience by tasting typical dishes in a local restaurant. By the way, the decision is up to you. included : Mining districts of Guanajuato - 3h - ENG (Private Service) Transport, guide - 9am to 2pm

Today marks the end of your journey through the colorful streets and rich history of Guanajuato. After breakfast, your private transportation will pick you up from your hotel and take you to the Guanajuato International Airport for your departure. Take this final moment to reflect on the experiences, flavors, and stories that made your visit unforgettable. We hope you leave with beautiful memories and the desire to return to Mexico’s vibrant heart. Safe travels and hasta pronto. included : Guanajuato - Guanajuato APT (Private Service)

tourName: Baja and the Sea of Cortez adventure cruises, Mexico
placesVisited: San Jose del Cabo, Isla San Francisco, Sea of Cortez, Bahia Agua Verde, Magdalena Bay, Baja grey whales, Los Islotes, Isla Partida, Isla Espiritu Santo, Sea kayaking, Paddle boarding, Yoga, Snorkelling, Hot tubs, Sauna
generalInfo:
This Sea of Cortez cruise around the most exquisite Baja Peninsula in Mexico is a naturalist’s nirvana, particularly if whale watching is something that you have always dreamed of. Baja California, to give its full name, is the second longest peninsula in the world, at over 1,200km in length and this small ship cruise explores the southern and eastern side of it, in a region known as Baja California Sur. This is where all the wildlife action takes place and this island-hopping adventure takes you into a world of sea turtles, boobies, pelicans, frigate birds, blue whales, grey whales, orca, humpback, pilot and fin whales, whale sharks, dolphins, mantas, and sea lions.

Grey whales, in particular, are a big attraction here because Baja is famous for its prolific numbers, coming to Sea of Cortez to mate and clustering in sheltered lagoons. As well as whale watching there are plenty of other wildlife watching experiences to be had, and other adventures too. These include kayaking in coastal mangroves, snorkelling in crystal clear coves, heading onto land to hike through coastal desert terrain, and visit traditional Mexican villages home to ‘sudcalifornianos’. Or just chilling out on one of many white sandy beaches.

Your vessel
Because this is a small cruise ship, we are able to access small coves that Mexico’s giant cruise ships can’t get to. Here we can make the most of the ship’s equipment, all of which appeal to the adventurers within. Such as kayaks, paddle boards, inflatable skiffs, yoga mats, snorkelling equipment, wetsuits, hydrophone and bow-mounted underwater camera. Then for chilling out in the evening we have two hot tubs, sauna, gym equipment and a massage room. All cabins are ensuite, have TV’s and air conditioning.

dayInfo.description: San Jose del Cabo / La Paz - Embarkation Bienvenidos! You will be met at the Los Cabos International Airport in San José del Cabo and transferred to our hospitality area. Joined by your expedition team, an overland orientation transfer to La Paz acquaints you with the dramatic Baja landscape and the week that lies ahead. The captain and crew welcome you aboard just in time for a cocktail and dinner with your new mates. What adventures await? Gray whale sightings? Whale Sharks? Dolphins? Fun on land and sea is a guarantee.(D)

Isla San Francisco Adventure in a playground of steep red bluffs and sweeping desert beach. Don some flippers for a snorkel among colorful sea life, put on your walking shoes for an exploratory romp along the ridge, grab a paddle and kayak, hop on a paddle board, or relax on the beach with the sand between your toes. The rugged beauty of the island makes it an ideal spot for escapades. (BLD)

Bahia Agua Verde At Bahía Agua Verde, clear waters are bordered by sparse craggy mountains hemmed in green. Explore the coast by small skiff looking for birds, seals, dolphins, and whales of all kinds; visit with a local ranchero and his family; and take to the canyons and mountains on a mule ride and experience the “real Baja.” Scenic vistas, outstanding exploration, excellent birding, and unmatched camaraderie - the day is done. (BLD)

Isla Coronado / Loreto Town Enjoy the beautiful beaches of Isla Coronado this morning - snorkel, kayak, or take a skiff tour. Watch for frigate birds and blue footed boobies in the air and dolphins and sea lions on the water - the waters here are so crystal clear you won't want to come back to the boat! It's worth it though - after lunch, set out to explore Loreto town. Founded in the 17th century by Jesuit missionaries, the downtown area features no fewer than seven historical monuments, including the Mission of our Lady or Loreto, the starting point of the Camino Real. Finish a day full of the best of nature and culture with a nightcap under the stars. (BLD)

Marine Life Search Mother Nature is your guide today. Take your adventurous side and your binoculars in search of the largest baleen whales in the world. The Sea of Cortés is home to fin, blue, and sperm whales, and the dolphin pods number in the hundreds. If the gray whales have arrived on Baja’s west coast (mid-January – early-March)—migrating more than 12,000 miles to calve in Bahía Magdalena—you’ll drive across the peninsula for a panga ride to observe these mammals and their babies in the lagoon. Mid-March through April are your best chance to see whale sharks near La Paz and in other parts of the Sea of Cortes. Later in the season, we have resident whales and dolphins in our sights. Whichever the day brings, there’s also a chance to head into the Sierra La Giganta Mountains for a tour of the crown jewel of Baja’s historic missions, San Javier; time for a brief exploration in magical Loreto; or more water play and hikes. Bring it on! (BLD)

Los Islotes / Isla Partida At Los Islotes—a steep craggy seamount leaping straight from the sea—slip into a wet suit for a snorkel with curious, agile young sea lion pups. At Isla Partida, get set for water play (kayaking, snorkeling, and stand up paddle boarding are all on the menu) and island hikes along desert beaches or into rocky arroyos. Or, kick back with a beach party—complete with a cool drink and sun-soaked lounge. (BLD)

Isla San Jose, Evaristo, or Nopolo Tuck into a secluded cove surrounded by long fingers of red rock and a golden beach. Spend your last full day enjoying the feel of warm sand under your feet on a beach walk, investigate nooks and crannies in the rocks by kayak, or explore a little further afield on a guided hike. Celebrate your week at tonight’s special Farewell Dinner with an entertaining slideshow by your expedition team. (BLD)
San Jose del Cabo - La Paz - Disembark After breakfast, it’s “adios” La Paz, as you transfer back to San José del Cabo for your flight or UnCruise hotel stay. (B)

tourName: Baja California self drive holiday
generalInfo: This travel program offers an unforgettable cultural and natural journey through Baja California Sur, beginning in the charming coastal city of La Paz, where you'll enjoy free days, sea lion encounters on Espiritu Santo Island, and the option to spot gray whales in season. The experience continues by road to the sustainable Cacachilas Ranch, with immersive workshops on beekeeping and artisanal cheesemaking, before arriving in Los Cabos. There, iconic beaches, sailing and snorkeling in the Sea of Cortez, world-class cuisine, and a vibrant cultural tour of San José del Cabo await you. A perfect trip that combines freedom, ecotourism, local culture, and spectacular landscapes from the desert to the sea.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to the Heart of the Sea of Cortez! Upon arrival at La Paz International Airport in Baja California Sur, you’ll be greeted by the charm of one of Mexico’s most beautiful coastal destinations—famous for its crystal-clear waters, pristine beaches, and relaxed seaside vibe. After landing, head to the car rental office to pick up your pre-booked vehicle. With keys in hand, your adventure begins! As you drive toward our hotel, soak in the breathtaking views along La Paz’s scenic Malecón, the golden beaches of the Gulf of California, local restaurants, and vibrant coastal life. Today is yours to enjoy at your own pace. Whether you choose to explore the city, unwind by the beach, or discover hidden gems around town, La Paz offers endless ways to create unforgettable memories. Overnight stay in this beautiful coastal paradise. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: *Time and unlimited mileage of the car, taxes and fees, ALI: Insurance against damages to third parties for $ 700,000 mexican pesos, LDW: Insurance against damages to the car with 0% deductible, TP: Insurance against theft of the car with 0% deductible, B2B: Insurance against damages to windows, mirrors, windshields, rims and tires, RA: Roadside Assistance (roadside assistance) 24 hours in case of breakdown or accident by the insurance company and additional driver (under previous reservation). *Accommodation in peace

This morning, our bilingual guide will meet us in the hotel lobby to begin an unforgettable adventure alongside fellow travelers: a visit to Espíritu Santo Island, a UNESCO World Heritage natural reserve. This stunning island is renowned for its raw beauty and rich marine life. Accompanied by our expert team, we’ll explore the vibrant underwater world and learn about the unique species that inhabit this protected area. The tour includes a 6-hour boat ride with snorkeling gear, life jackets, and official access permits to the Protected Natural Area. One of the highlights of the day is snorkeling near a sea lion colony (seasonal), a magical experience where you can observe these playful creatures in their natural habitat. We’ll also visit Playa Ensenada Grande, one of the most picturesque beaches in La Paz. Located on the western coast of Isla Partida—separated from Espíritu Santo by a narrow channel—this beach lies within the Espíritu Santo Archipelago National Park. As a protected zone, access is regulated, and there are no tourist facilities such as restrooms or shops. Responsible tourism is encouraged: no littering, no damaging plants or animals, and no removal of natural elements. After this eco-adventure, we’ll return to the hotel for a well-deserved rest. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Transportation from your hotel • Panga boat ride with shade and restroom • Sea lion watching • Snorkeling with sea lions (not available in June, July, and August) • Visit to Ensenada Grande Beach • Lunch: Fish ceviche and ham and cheese sandwiches • Drinks: Water and soft drinks • Life jacket and snorkeling equipment • Access to the Protected Natural Area • Guide • Accommodation in peace

Today, for those who wish to participate, our bilingual guide will pick us up at the hotel to experience one of Baja California Sur’s most iconic natural spectacles: gray whale watching. Each year, these majestic giants travel over 20,000 kilometers from the icy waters of the Bering Strait to the warm lagoons of Baja California to breed and give birth. The whale watching season runs from January 15th to March 15th, with tours typically departing toward Magdalena Bay or Puerto Chale, located 2–3 hours from La Paz. Upon arrival, we’ll board a traditional panga boat, guided by a certified naturalist who will share fascinating insights into the behavior and biology of gray whales. During the excursion, it’s common to witness whales surfacing, blowing impressive spouts, swimming alongside the boat, and even engaging in gentle, up-close encounters with visitors—truly unforgettable moments. At the end of this magical experience, we’ll return to La Paz and enjoy a free afternoon to relax or explore more of the city on our own. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Accommodation in peace

Today is a free day to continue exploring the incredible city of La Paz at your own pace. We recommend a relaxing walk along the Malecón, the city's scenic waterfront promenade. It’s the perfect place to meet locals, exercise, or simply enjoy the dazzling colors of a Baja sunset. You might also want to visit cultural landmarks such as the Center for Arts and Popular Cultures, the historic Mission of Nuestra Señora del Pilar de La Paz Airapí, or the Museum of the Whale and Marine Sciences. For families, there are several playgrounds along the Malecón and fun stops like La Fuente, a traditional ice cream shop perfect for cooling off with a delicious coconut or fruit popsicle. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Accommodation in peace

Today we take the road again! We’ll drive just 43 minutes from La Paz to reach our next destination: Rancho Cacachilas, a holistic experience surrounded by endemic nature with a focus on sustainability and regenerative practices. Here, you'll learn about sustainable honey production and circular economy practices in cheese making. You'll also enjoy a farm-to-table organic meal, prepared with fresh ingredients straight from the ranch. These one-day immersive experiences offer the chance to dive into the rich biodiversity, culture, and history of the Sierra de Las Cacachilas—a day filled with nature, fun, and meaningful learning. You can choose between two unique workshops (please select your preference prior to arrival): Cheese-Making Workshop: Learn everything about our award-winning handcrafted goat cheese—from caring for and pampering our goats to the full artisanal cheese-making process. Beekeeping Workshop: Enter the fascinating world of bees! Discover their vital role in the ecosystem and learn about the sustainable and respectful honey harvesting process practiced at Rancho Cacachilas. After our activity, we’ll drive on to Los Cabos, where we’ll check in to our hotel. Overnight stay in Los Cabos. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Stay in Los Cabos • Activity to choose

Today, you’ll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in one of the most iconic beach destinations in the world. Los Cabos, located at the southernmost tip of the Baja California Peninsula in Mexico, is a stunning fusion of desert landscapes, turquoise waters, and luxury experiences. This world-class paradise offers something for every traveler—from adrenaline-pumping water sports and thrilling outdoor adventures to serene moments of relaxation and rich cultural immersion. A must-see is the famous Lover’s Beach, nestled beside the iconic natural formation El Arco, a symbol of Los Cabos where the Pacific Ocean meets the Sea of Cortez. Gastronomically, Los Cabos ranks among Mexico’s most compelling culinary destinations. The region boasts a dynamic and sophisticated food scene, where chefs blend local and international influences with an emphasis on farm-to-table and sea-to-table freshness. Expect an array of fine dining experiences and local eateries committed to sustainability and flavor excellence. Overnight stay in Los Cabos. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Accommodation in Los Cabos

Today, at the scheduled time, our guide will pick you up at the hotel to embark on a remarkable sailing and snorkeling experience along the breathtaking coastline of Los Cabos. Aboard a catamaran, you’ll glide across the crystalline waters of the Sea of Cortez, taking in panoramic views of El Arco, Lover’s Beach, and a vibrant colony of sea lions basking in the sun. The excursion includes opportunities for snorkeling in rich marine habitats, stand-up paddleboarding, and sunbathing on deck—culminating in a freshly prepared gourmet lunch served onboard. Keep your eyes open for a spectacular array of marine life including dolphins, manta rays, and—during winter months—breaching humpback whales, one of the most awe-inspiring natural encounters in the region. Return to your hotel and overnight stay in Los Cabos. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Pickup from your hotel • Bottled water • Light snacks • Snorkeling equipment • Wetsuit (in winter) • Stand-up paddleboards • Motorized snorkel and kayak • Accommodation in Los Cabos

Enjoy a final day at leisure to further explore the captivating destination of Los Cabos. For a memorable farewell, we recommend spending your evening in San José del Cabo, where culture and charm come alive. Begin your night with a glass of fine wine and a Baja-style appetizer, then stroll through the colorful and lively Art District, known for its vibrant galleries and local craftsmanship. Visit the charming Plaza Mijares and treat yourself to a refreshing artisan ice cream or popsicle from a local paletería with cultural flair. Explore historical landmarks such as El Zócalo and the old Jesuit Mission, then step into unique art galleries showcasing sculptures made from recycled materials. Experience the creative spirit of Emotions By Corsica, and interact with innovative pieces at the Iván Guaderrama Gallery. Afterward, enjoy some free time to soak in the atmosphere or do some last-minute shopping. Return to your hotel and overnight stay in Los Cabos. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Accommodation in Los Cabos

As your unforgettable adventure comes to an end, today you’ll drive yourself to Los Cabos International Airport. Please ensure you allow enough time to return your rental car and check in for your flight, so you can relax and enjoy your final moments in paradise. We wish you a smooth journey and a pleasant flight. Thank you sincerely for choosing us for your recent trip to Mexico—it was a pleasure to have you, and we hope your experience exploring our beautiful country was truly unforgettable. Rental car drop-off at Los Cabos Airport is included. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel

tourName: Baja family holiday in Mexico
generalInfo:
The breathtakingly beautiful peninsular of Baja California is a long strip of rugged cactus strewn desert and dramatic coastline sandwiched between the Sea of Cortes and the Pacific Ocean. It’s landscape is a mecca for activities for all ages and its seascape offers some of the best marine life experiences on the planet. Getting close up with grey whales is a magical experience that will live with you forever. Swim with a sea-lion colony, paddleboard and kayak the tranquil coves of Espiritu Santo. On terra firma experience horseback riding from a remote desert camp. The town of Todos Santos is a small, charming place where art, cultural and culinary experiences complete the best of Baja.

As a family destination Baja has everything, great weather, fantastic food without fuss! Although Baja has its own unique Mexican character it s proximity to the US does mean that the general infrastructure is of a high standard. In addition to that, English is widely spoken. Activities vary but there will always be something for children of all ages. Whether you're getting up close to a grey whale with your toddler or sup boarding with your teen!

Plenty of cool bars and galleries too in the sublimely pretty Todos Santos for the grown ups too.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Todos Santos: Today you'll arrive at the airport in San Jose del Cabo (please see INFORMATION page for arrival details and procedures) where you will be met by your guide. Please go with him/her for the 90 minute transfer to Todos Santos and Los Colibris Casitas. Upon arrival we'll get you get settled into your lovely rooms with beautiful ocean views, then we'll have a gourmet taco welcome dinner on the Los Colibris grounds at Iker's Colibris Cafe. During dinner your guide will host a trip briefing, outlining the adventures to come.

Surfing / Todos Santos Historical Tour / Taco Crawl: We'll start off this great vacation learning to ride the waves at Los Cerritos, one of the best surf breaks in Baja. Our instructors guarantee that you'll stand up on your board - at least for a moment - during your hour of instruction. It's a total blast! We'll then head to the heart of the pueblo magico of Todos Santos, which has a well-deserved reputation as a food lover’s paradise. There is really no better place to indulge in Baja California Sur’s greatest contribution to world cuisine: the fish taco! We'll enjoy an epic taco tour to 3 of our favorite local joints to sample not only fish tacos, but other types of tacos drawing on the area’s bounties of land and sea. You might find several different types of ceviche out there too! Todos Santos has a rich and varied history, from the early missionaries, through the booming sugar years, through its current incarnation as an artists’ colony, agricultural center and surfing hotspot. After our taco crawl we'll visit many of the historic homes and buildings throughout town, learning fascinating stories of the global forces and colorful personalities that brought these buildings into existence and shaped Todos Santos over the years. We will also visit the studios of working artists who make their homes in – and gain their inspiration from — Todos Santos. Dinner at a terrific local restaurant tonight.

Pacific Bluffs Cliff Walk / Mexican Cooking Class: Glorious scenery, fascinating local history and encounters with strange and wonderful flora and fauna. Our Pacific bluffs cliff walk starts at Punta Lobos, the sweeping Pacific beach where the local fishermen of Todos Santos launch their boats each morning and bring in the daily catch each afternoon. A quick walk up the hill brings us to breath-taking views of a different kind of coastline, with dramatic rocky outcroppings and crashing surf. We´re likely to spot whales from this high vantage point during several months of the year. Throughout the walk we´ll have the stunning combination of desert landscape running to the sea. We´ll pass an active sea lion colony, as well as the ruins of the shipping port Los Algodones. Your guide will offer in-depth commentary on the terrific variety of flora and fauna you see, as well as the history of the area from the human perspective.After about 3.5 hours of walking we´ll arrive at the idyllic beach of San Pedro where a picnic lunch will be waiting. San Pedro features a beautiful marsh filled with bird life and a protective cove ringed by towering palms. Here we´ll eat, relax, sunbathe, swim, read - just enjoy the bliss of being in Baja! In the evening we'll have our Mexican Survival Cooking Class with Chef Iker, author of Cooking Adventures in Baja California Sur. First, learn to make a great margarita. Second, pay attention because you have to eat what you make!

Camp Cecil de la Sierra and the La Laguna Biosphere Reserve: Camp Cecil de la Sierra is a luxury tent camp in a mango and grapefruit grove in the Sierra La Laguna Biosphere Reserve of Baja California Sur, about 90 minutes from Todos Santos. It is the sister property to our award-winning Camp Cecil de la Isla on Isla Espiritu Santo. Camp Cecil de la Sierra is on the property of a local ranching family, and the camp highlights both the cultural and natural heritage of the Sierras. The family is an integral part of the experience, providing all the meat, cheese and tortillas for the camp, teaching guests how to make tortillas and empanadasin the traditional manner, and acting as guides in the reserve. The Sierra La Laguna Biosphere Reserve is one of Baja´s most beautiful but least explored areas. Part of an island off the coast of Baja 10 million years ago, the Reserve is one of the most biodiverse areas in the world. Reflecting it's long history of island isolation, almost 25% of plants and 10% of animals found in the Reserve are endemic to the area, i.e, they are not found anywhere else on the planet. Activities at the camp include beautiful hikes in the reserve, with opportunities to get terrific views of the Pacific ocean, swim in watering holes and picnic by waterfalls. There is fantastic birding in the early mornings, amazing star gazing at night, and plenty of opportunities to interact with the ranch family and work with them making cheese, tortillas and other products in the traditional manner. You can also just hang out in the shade of the mango trees and enjoy the books in the library, perhaps while sipping a margarita.

Sierra de la Laguna: Perhaps we'll start the day with some birding around camp early in the morning, enjoy an amazing ranch breakfast, then head out for a great hike through the mountains, taking in some spectacular views. Upon our return we'll enjoy happy hour in the huerta, then a great ranch dinner prepared by our chef. And if you're awake late enough, we'll enjoy the stars in the clear mountain air. A magnificent day.

Isla Espiritu Santo: Sea of Cortez and Camp Cecil Adventure! After a final ranch breakfast we're off to Isla Espiritu Santo and Camp Cecil de la Isla today! We'll drive to La Paz, go to our bodega to get snorkeling gear and wet suits, then it's on to the boats and out into the Sea of Cortez! Camp Cecil is on Isla Espiritu Santo which is in a National Marine Park, part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and is one of the best marine life viewing destinations in the world. Whales, dolphins, whale sharks, sea turtles, manta rays and plenty of beautiful tropical fish call the surrounding waters home, while a terrific range of bird species including Blue-footed Boobies, Reddish Egrets, Great Blue Herons and Yellow-footed Gulls frequent the island’s skies and shores. The island itself is stunning, with magnificent towering cliffs, spectacular sandy bays, amazing lava rock formations, and rock art left by the now-extinct Guaycura and Pericu Indians. There’s even an endemic ring-tailed cat, the babisuri. It’s a remarkable place to explore. We’ll spend the days doing exactly what pleases us - kayaking, snorkeling, hiking, swimming with sea lions, stand up paddle boarding, bird watching, and exploring hidden lagoons and desert beaches. Hanging around doing nothing, reading trashy novels and sipping margaritas also highly encouraged.

Isla Espiritu Santo: Another day of island riches. Perhaps paddle board with sea turtles, or snorkel with sea lions, maybe spot some whales, or dance with some Blue-footed Boobies. Whatever surprises the day may hold, you can be sure that it will also include magnificent food and drink!
Isla Espiritu Santo: One more day to enjoy the pure bliss of island living in Baja!

Whale Sharks!: Today we'll depart from Camp Cecil and head for one of the most amazing experiences yet - swimming with the largest fish in the world - the whale shark! Of course, you may be asking yourself: is it a whale or is it a shark? Hint: whales are mammals and sharks are fish. These gentle giants feed on plankton in the Bay of La Paz (so all human flesh is safe), and it is here that we have the remarkable experience of observing and swimming with them. In the afternoon we'll head to our La Paz hotel, Hotel Catedral, right on the town plaza. We'll have dinner at a terrific local restaurant and start dreaming of the wondrous possibilities that await us the next day with the gray whales of Magdalena Bay.

Magdalen Bay (Bahla Magdalena) Whale Watching Adventure: Magdalena Bay is the largest wetlands ecosystem on the west coast of Baja and one of the most important in North America. The World Wildlife Fund ranks it as one of the most important coastal habitats in Mexico. The Bay is the prime calving ground for the gray whale, and January to March it is possible to see a large number of whales, including mothers and calves. Magdalena Bay also has mangrove forests, barrier beaches and sand dune islands, all of which contribute to the incredible scenery and biological diversity of the area. This morning we'll transfer the 4.5 hours to Magdalena Bay, have lunch, then head out onto the water for 3 hours of interacting with the amazing gray whale mothers, babies, young couples and sporting males. We'll have dinner and spend the night in a local hotel

Whale Watching / Return to Todos Santos: Things that often happen to us during our two-day/one-night trip in Magdalena Bay: • Gray whale mothers bring their babies right up to the boat to say hello • Gray whale babies present themselves for a good rub or a pat • Gray whale males sidle along the boat and spout water on us – they clearly think it´s very funny • Gray whales of all types bring their huge heads out of the water and look us straight in the eye And that´s just to give you an idea! Today we'll have 3 more hours of interacting with the whales then head back to Todos Santos with a celebratory lunch stop along the way. Dinner at a great local restaurant.
Transfer to the Airport for your Flight Home!: You will be transferred back to the airport for your flight home.

tourName: Baja kayaking and whale watching holiday
generalInfo:
Come face-to-face with magnificent gray whales before kayaking through Loreto Bay National Marine Park on this week-long itinerary in Baja California Sur. This active itinerary celebrates two of the peninsula’s top wildlife activities, with a combination of hotel stays and nights spent under the stars at blissfully remote beachside camps.  
 
Magdalena Bay is an important calving lagoon for gray whales, with its sheltered waters framed by a barrier of desert islands. Its mangrove-lined estuaries provide a habitat for a variety of bird species, as well as uniquely adapted desert plants. January through March is the best time to observe gray whales in the area, following their 5,000+ mile migration from the Bering Strait.  
 
After witnessing these magnificent animals breach and fluke from the comfort of our exclusive whale camp, we’ll cross the Baja Peninsula to paddle alongside dolphins and blue whales in the Sea of Cortez. Loreto Bay National Marine Park also provides a sanctuary for blue-footed boobies, fin whales, and sea lions, making it an inspiring destination for wildlife lovers.

*All activities are led by naturalist guides who have a wealth of knowledge about the local area. While we do our best to adhere to the schedule, changes may occur due to weather conditions and in some cases, the kayaking portion of the itinerary may precede the whale watching. Although there is a very good chance that you will see whales during the trip, the frequency and proximity cannot be guaranteed as this is determined by the animals themselves.

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Loreto - After flying into Loreto, make your way to the hotel (not included) and spend the afternoon touring the historic center of town. Visit the famous mission and soak up the sights, sounds, and smells of the local market before feasting on Mexican cuisine over dinner. In the evening, you’ll meet your guides in the lobby of the Oasis Hotel for an orientation meeting.

Magdalena Bay - Today begins early with a two-hour drive to Puerto Lopez Mateos, the starting point for our whale-watching excursion in Magdalena Bay. A skiff will transport you to Santo Domingo Island where our camp is located and on arrival, you’ll have time to settle into your tent (pre-assembled) before lunch is served. In the afternoon, your guides will take you on a hike across the dunes to the Pacific Ocean before returning to the camp in time for happy hour. Accommodations: Whale Camp. Meals Included: Lunch, Dinner.

Magdalena Bay - Wake to the sounds of birds calling as you rise from your tent to enjoy a cup of freshly made tea or coffee. Stroll along the beach while keeping your eyes peeled for whales migrating offshore. After breakfast, we will take to the waters for another whale-watching cruise, followed by plenty of free time to explore the dunes or simply relax on the sands. You may also opt to go on a birdwatching tour in the mangroves that fringe the nearby lagoon. Accommodations: Whale Camp. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner.

Loreto - Begin the day with a two-hour whale-watching session before we return to Puerto Lopez Mateo. Here, you will have time to explore the shops surrounding the port before we enjoy lunch at a local seafood restaurant. In the afternoon, we will return to Loreto and check back into the Oasis Hotel before an orientation meeting in the lobby to chat about the kayaking days that lie ahead. Dinner is at a restaurant of your choice. Accommodations: Oasis Hotel. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch.

Sea of Cortez - After breakfast, you will be transported to our kayak launch site where your guides will lead you through the basics of paddling and explain our safety procedures. Once everyone feels comfortable, we will make the 2 to 3-mile crossing to the nearby islands where you will have time to go snorkeling or hiking through the desert landscapes. This evening will be spent in spacious dome tents, although many guests opt to sleep out under the stars due to Baja’s lack of biting insects. Accommodations: Island Beach Camping. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner.

Sea of Cortez - Begin the day with a hearty breakfast before we head out paddling. Today's excursion will take us along the rugged coastlines of Isla Danzante and Isla Carmen, both of which feature spectacular cliffs and hidden coves. There will be plenty of opportunities to go snorkeling, beachcombing, and hiking along the way before a night of stargazing. Accommodations: Island Beach Camping. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner.

Loreto - After breakfast at the camp, we’ll paddle to the take-out site and have lunch before returning to Loreto. Here, you’ll have time for an afternoon siesta or another exploration of the town center. In the evening, we’ll congregate for a farewell dinner as you say goodbye to your guides and newfound friends. Accommodations: Not included. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch.
Departure - With no scheduled activities, you are free to depart Loreto at a time that suits you.

tourName: Baja multi activity holiday, Mexico
generalInfo: The breathtakingly beautiful peninsular of Baja California is a long strip of rugged cactus strewn desert and dramatic coastline sandwiched between the Sea of Cortes and the Pacific Ocean. It’s landscape is a mecca for activities and its seascape offers some of the best marine life experiences on the planet. Getting close up with whale sharks in La Paz Bay- it’s is a magical experience that will live with you forever. Swim with a sea-lion colony, paddleboard and kayak the tranquil coves of Espirtu Santo. On terra firma experience horseback riding from a remote desert camp. The town of Todos Santos is a small, charming place where art, cultural and culinary experiences complete a breath taking Baja adventure.

dayInfo.description: Todos Santos: Today you'll arrive at the airport in San Jose del Cabo (please see INFORMATION page for arrival details and procedures) where you will be met by your guide. Please go with him/her for the 90 minute transfer to Todos Santos and Los Colibris Casitas. Upon arrival we'll get you get settled into your lovely rooms with beautiful ocean views, then we'll have a gourmet taco welcome dinner on the Los Colibris grounds at Iker's Colibris Cafe. During dinner your guide will host a trip briefing, outlining the adventures to come.

Surfing / Todos Santos Historical Tour / Taco Crawl: We'll start off this great vacation learning to ride the waves at Los Cerritos, one of the best surf breaks in Baja. Our instructors guarantee that you'll stand up on your board - at least for a moment - during your hour of instruction. It's a total blast! We'll then head to the heart of the pueblo magico of Todos Santos, which has a well-deserved reputation as a food lover’s paradise. There is really no better place to indulge in Baja California Sur’s greatest contribution to world cuisine: the fish taco! We'll enjoy an epic taco tour to 3 of our favorite local joints to sample not only fish tacos, but other types of tacos drawing on the area’s bounties of land and sea. You might find several different types of ceviche out there too! Todos Santos has a rich and varied history, from the early missionaries, through the booming sugar years, through its current incarnation as an artists’ colony, agricultural center and surfing hotspot. After our taco crawl we'll visit many of the historic homes and buildings throughout town, learning fascinating stories of the global forces and colorful personalities that brought these buildings into existence and shaped Todos Santos over the years. We will also visit the studios of working artists who make their homes in – and gain their inspiration from — Todos Santos.

Todos Santo: Pacific Bluffs Cliff Walk / Mexican Cooking Class Glorious scenery, fascinating local history and encounters with strange and wonderful flora and fauna. Our Pacific bluffs cliff walk starts at Punta Lobos, the sweeping Pacific beach where the local fishermen of Todos Santos launch their boats each morning and bring in the daily catch each afternoon. A quick walk up the hill brings us to breath-taking views of a different kind of coastline, with dramatic rocky outcroppings and crashing surf. We´re likely to spot whales from this high vantage point during several months of the year. Throughout the walk we´ll have the stunning combination of desert landscape running to the sea. We´ll pass an active sea lion colony, as well as the ruins of the shipping port Los Algodones. Your guide will offer in-depth commentary on the terrific variety of flora and fauna you see, as well as the history of the area from the human perspective.After about 3.5 hours of walking we´ll arrive at the idyllic beach of San Pedro where a picnic lunch will be waiting. San Pedro features a beautiful marsh filled with bird life and a protective cove ringed by towering palms. Here we´ll eat, relax, sunbathe, swim, read - just enjoy the bliss of being in Baja! In the evening we'll have our Mexican Survival Cooking Class with Chef Iker, author of Cooking Adventures in Baja California Sur. First, learn to make a great margarita. Second, pay attention because you have to eat what you make!

Camp Cecil de la Sierra and the Sierra La Laguna Biosphere Reserve: Camp Cecil de la Sierra is a luxury tent camp in a mango and grapefruit grove in the Sierra La Laguna Biosphere Reserve of Baja California Sur, about 90 minutes from Todos Santos. It is the sister property to our award-winning Camp Cecil de la Isla on Isla Espiritu Santo. Upon our return we'll enjoy happy hour in the huerta, then a great ranch dinner prepared by our chef. And if you're awake late enough, we'll enjoy the stars in the clear mountain air. A magnificent day.

Sea of Cortez and Camp Cecil Adventure!: After a final ranch breakfast we're off to Isla Espiritu Santo and Camp Cecil de la Isla today! We'll drive to La Paz, go to our bodega to get snorkeling gear and wet suits, then it's on to the boats and out into the Sea of Cortez! Isla Espiritu Santo: One more day to enjoy the pure bliss of island living in Baja!

These gentle giants feed on plankton in the Bay of La Paz (so all human flesh is safe), and it is here that we have the remarkable experience of observing and swimming with them. In the afternoon we'll head back to Todos Santos and Los Colibris, and have a wonderful chef-prepared dinner at the hotel.
Todos Santos: Today we'll have a free day to exactly as we please - get a massage, take a hike, do some shopping - however the spirit moves you! Farewell dinner at a wonderful restaurant in town.
Flight Home Sadly- final day – transfer to the airport.

tourName: Baja sea kayaking holiday in Mexico
generalInfo:
Baja is a wild landscape where russet peaks plunge to sparkling turquoise waters and white sand beaches. Cacti and desert flowers cap colorful rockface beneath a cobalt sky. This land of endless sunshine nurtures an astonishing amount of wild creatures, for amidst the arid terrain, life prevails in multi-hued forms. Soaring osprey and desert hawks share airspace with ungainly pelicans, and surprisingly agile blue-footed boobies dot seaside outcrops. Cormorants and other sea birds parade the shoreline, while skittering Sally Lightfoot crabs plunder the tidal range for their rich feasts.

The real action, however, flourishes beneath the waves. Home to 1/3 of the world's marine mammal species, the Sea of Cortez is renowned for leaping dolphins and enormous whales. Even the great blue whales, the largest mammal to have ever lived on planet Earth, can be found in these azure waters. Dubbed by Jacques Cousteau as "The World's Aquarium," over 800 species of fish swim these waters, including the famous "flying" mobula rays that leap out of the water in sheer delight. This diversity of plant and animal life is unmatched anywhere in the world, which spurred the protection of this area as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It also makes for a fantastic winter holiday!

Spend a sun-and-sand vacation exploring the Sea of Cortez by kayak, hiking, and snorkeling these turquoise waters. By day, delight in sunshine and warm waters while you watch the array of marine life as you paddle around the protected islands of the Loreto Bay National Marine Park & Espiritu Santo. You will spend about 4 hours on the water, with a long lunch break and plenty of time to hike to breathtaking vistas, snorkel secret coves, or relax in the sand. Camp on sandy beaches and witness sunset pelican dives during happy hour. As the sky's palette turns to night, watch how Baja's lack of light pollution unveils a velvety black canvas with constellations you've never seen. Splash in the ocean's bioluminescence before bed, and wake up to another morning in wild paradise.

Skilled guides, many of whom are marine biologists, will enrich your experience with their knowledge of the land and wildlife. Your meals will be prepared from scratch using local flavors with fresh ingredients. Imagine waking to a sunrise on the beach with tea or coffee waiting, and the smells of a hot breakfast wafting toward your tent. While lunch is prepared, go for a hike or a snorkeling session with the warm sun on your back. Happy hour drinks and hors d'oeuvres tease the palate as the guides create a culinary delight for your dinner. But keep your eyes on the horizon, lest you miss a pod of passing dolphins or a sea turtle gliding out of the waves.

These Baja Sea of Cortez kayaking and camping tours range from 3-6 days of paddling, complete with all gear and guides included in the tour price. Just bring your clothing! Novices and families welcome. Use the benefit of our experience to create your best vacation!

dayInfo.description: Arrival date. Fly into Loreto, Baja. Once you're settled in the tour hotel (not included in trip cost), your guides will give a thorough orientation meeting at Hotel Oasis and answer questions about your upcoming wilderness adventure.

Launch day. You will be transported from the tour hotel to the launch site for the kayaks. Here, you will pack your belongings (in provided dry bags) into the kayak hatches, and your guides will teach you the ropes of paddling a sturdy sea kayak. You won't leave shore until you're comfortable in your cockpit. You'll cross to the islands, stop for lunch, and then paddle to your first campsite. The guides prepare all meals and show you how to set up your tent.

Over the next few days, you'll paddle the coastlines of the islands in the Sea of Cortez. Dolphins, whales, or other marine mammals ma make frequent appearances. Awake to spectacular sunrises, and spend happy hour with brilliant sunsets in a landscape that thrills the senses. You'll change campsites nearly every day, but may have a layover site for one evening. Most of these beaches offer hikes to stunning vistas, and snorkeling is an ever-present opportunity. Itineraries range from 3-6 days paddling. On your final day kayaking, you'll return to the Baja peninsula in the afternoon, with plenty of time to freshen up for a farewell dinner with your guides. Sleep deeply in the tour hotel this evening (not included in trip cost).

Departure day. Awaken in the tour hotel and enjoy breakfast in town before departing for the airport. Alternatively, extend your stay in these beautiful seaside downs with a variety of day tours, from whale watching to hiking to fishing. Or, join our exclusive gray whale watching camp after kayaking, for the closest wild whale encounter on Earth.

tourName: Baja whale watching safari in Mexico
generalInfo:
Set on an island in the Pacific ocean, your stay at our exclusive gray whale safari camp will be a complete immersion into this spectacular wilderness and the world of the whales. Gray whales migrate from the Arctic circle down the Pacific coastline to Baja, where they frolic in the desert sunshine for a few short months to mate and give birth. Sand dune barrier islands form calving lagoons where the whales congregate for their springtime festivities. From mid-January through the end of March, these shallow lagoons are a haven to hundreds of whales and their newborn calves.

Moreover, these Baja gray whales have actually become friendly and curious toward humans. What started with a gentle rub between a lone gray whale and a young fisherman has become a breathtaking phenomenon among the entire population, as these whales now actively seek interaction with people. Mothers will often bring their calves right over to whale watching boats for an eye-to-eye encounter.

When you join us in Baja for a stay at our gray whale base camp, you'll have more than just whale time - though there is plenty of that! The most spectacular feature of our exclusive campsite is the proximity to the whales. Our site is located right where the lagoon meets the Pacific ocean. This is where the whales are most concentrated. Consequently, you can usually see whales right from camp throughout the day. At times, you may feel utterly surrounded by whales!

You'll visit the whales by motorized skiff (6 people per boat) twice per day for up-close encounters, and then will return to camp to watch whales from shore and learn about their environments from your naturalist guides. All of your guides are local, bilingual Mexicans, and many are marine biologists from the nearby University of La Paz.

The accommodations at our safari-style camp are as luxurious as can be found in the wild, yet still allow us to remove all trace of human presence once the whales leave. You will sleep in full-height canvas tents on sleeping cots with inflatable air pads. A solar shower stall and El Bano with a porta potty are also provided. Your guides will prepare warm, savory meals made from fresh ingredients right in the middle of the wilderness while you relax with a drink, comb the beach, or take a walk over the dunes to watch the sun set over the Pacific ocean. This is Leave-No-Trace camping at its finest!

Though the whales are the stars of the tour, the desert ecosystem is fascinating to explore. Acres of mangroves flock the lagoon, which make this area a bird-watchers paradise. Dolphins frequently zip into the bay for a snack, often catching fish just feet from the waters' edge. Coyotes and desert hares skip over the dunes, and the delicate desert flora offers a startling array of colors and unique Baja beauty.

Tours begin in Loreto, Baja, or La Paz, Baja, making this a perfect addition to a thrilling winter escape!

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Loreto or La Paz (any time). Meet your guides for an orientation meeting this evening, and then explore the city for tasty Baja cuisine.

Depart Loreto or La Paz bright and early for the van ride across the Baja peninsula. You will arrive at Puerto Lopez Mateo off Magdalena Bay at 9:30 in the morning, just in time to start your first whale watching session! You can sometimes see the whales right from the dock, so keep your eyes peeled for a jaw-dropping experience. After whale watching, you'll journey by boat to our exclusive camp site among the barrier island sand dunes. After you've settled into the tent that awaits, you'll enjoy a fresh lunch before an interpretive hike across the dunes to the Pacific ocean. Meander back to camp along the beach, enjoying the waves, seashells, and whales off shore, and then relax with happy hour hors d'oeuvres and drinks before a warm dinner and whale presentation. Once darkness falls, take a moment to gaze at the stars in Baja's stunning lack of light pollution, or cozy up in bed for the next day.

Awake to coffee, tea, and an early morning snack. Watch the sun rise over a lagoon full of whales, or enjoy the sight of the rays burning off a foggy sky. A hot breakfast will be prepared and served on tables right on the beach. After breakfast, you'll commence with another whale watching session and then return to camp for lunch and a siesta or stroll on the beach. A second session is included in this afternoon, and if you prefer, you can select a part whale-watching, part-bird watching in the mangroves trip. Happy hour will await you this evening, followed by dinner and games or storytelling before bed.

Rise to see the sun shining once more over the lagoon and sand dunes. Tea and coffee will again meet you in the morning, followed by another hot breakfast with a local flair. After packing your bags, you'll board a panga for your last whale watching session before returning to the dock at Lopez Mateos. A hot seafood lunch is included at a local restaurant before the van ride back to Loreto or La Paz. You'll have a chance to clean up and explore the town again before a farewell dinner with your group and guides this evening to toast the memories and new friendships.
Departure day. After checking out of your hotel room, you're free to depart any time this day. Note: itineraries are also available for 6-day tours, which include one more full day at camp.

tourName: Best of Mexico tour
generalInfo:
Hola and welcome to Mexico! A massive, diverse and colourful country, there’s something for everyone in this lively destination. From the streets of Mexico City to ancient Mayan ruins and the beaches of Playa Del Carmen, Viva Mexico will have your exploring all of the highlights on an unforgettable 14 day adventure. With an awesome group leader from the moment you land, an instant new group of friends, activities and accommodation included, and help with all your onward travel, get ready for a fiesta!

HIGHLIGHTS

- Immerse yourself in the bustle of Mexico City
- Try local spirits at a mezcal distillery
- Visit the Indigenous communities of San Juan Chamula and Zinacantan to witness the melting-pot of ancient Mayan beliefs and contemporary religions
- Explore the mystical Mayan ruins at Chichén Itzá & the refreshing Cenote Chukum
- Dive into the tropical paradise of Isla Holbox on an exciting boat tour, where you might just encounter some wild pink flamingos (seasonal)
- Relax on the Yucatan Peninsula’s whitest beaches and get amongst Playa Del Carmen’s buzzing nightlife

INCLUSIONS

Airport pickup
13 nights accommodation
Orientation tours of Mexico City
Oaxaca and San Cristobal de las Casas
Mezcal distillery tour
Boat tour of Sumidero Canyon
Indigenous community visit
Island boat tour of Isla Holbox
Natural pools
Pink Flamingos (seasonal)
Internal flight to Cancun
Entrance to Chichen Itza
Entrance to Cenote
Meals as indicated on itinerary
All transport including internal flights
Awesome group leader and local guides
Onward travel help & planning
24/7 support after the trip finishes

dayInfo.description: Arrive in Mexico City! - Hola! Once you arrive in Mexico City we’ll take you to straight to our hotel. You’ll have plenty of time to recover from your flight before meeting up with everyone in the group and getting excited for what’s to come.

Explore Mexico City - What a place to begin our adventure! Known for mountainous surrounds, rich history and incredible buildings, we’ll kick things off with an orientation around the historical centre. Wandering bustling streets, we’ll learn about the Aztec Empire and history of Spanish Conquest as well as check out icons like Cathedral Metropolitan and Zocalo. The afternoon is yours to explore, opt to check out a museum or listen to a mariachi song. Tonight we’ll refuel with a traditional Mexican dinner and show!

Travel to Puebla and Oaxaca - Saying adios to the city, today we’ll depart for one of the many 'Magic Towns', Puebla, a beautiful colonial town flanked by volcanoes. Here we’ll learn about the history of the area - such as, this town is where Cinco de Mayo originates from! After lunch we’ll continue our journey to Oaxaca, where we will check in to our accommodation. We’ll then head out and experience the streets by moonlight, hitting up the bars and restaurants!

Explore Oaxaca - We'll begin the day by exploring the streets of Oaxaca in daylight. Then we’re learning be learning about how hand-made textiles are produced from a local family. We’ll then travel into the valley to visit a traditional mezcal distillery. We’ll learn all about this energising spirit, then we’ll head to the beautiful town of Tehuantepec, where we will spend the night.

Oaxaca & Mezcal Distillery - Enjoy a chill morning before we head into the valleys to visit a local family to learn how hand-made textiles are produced. After that, we will pop over to a visit a traditional mezcal distillery. We’ll learn all about this energizing spirit before continuing our journey down to Tehuantepec for our overnight stop.

Canyons & Mountains - Jumping on a boat, today we’ll discover some of Mexico’s natural beauty. Cruising through the Canyon of Sumidero we’ll see cascading waterfalls, rich jungle, and cross our fingers in the hopes of spotting some cheeky monkeys and lurking crocodiles. Later we’re heading up into the mountains for our next stop, the delightful colonial town of San Cristobal de las Casas. We will walk you around the charming town of San Cristobal with an optional pottery class for those wanting to show their artistic flare.

Ancient Culture - We’ll visit a local family in the charming town of Zinacantán before heading to San Juan Chamula to explore and visit its unique church. Back in San Cristóbal de las Casas, you’ll have time to wander the city, savor Chiapas’ famous coffee, and try Pox - a traditional regional drink, before enjoying a delicious dinner.
Fly from San Cristobal to Cancun - Leaving beautiful San Cristobal, today we hop on an included flight across Mexico and land in the wonderful hustle and bustle of Cancun, for a short overnight stay.

Paradise Awaits - This morning, we’re catching a ferry to Isla Holbox, aka paradise! Imagine sunny beaches, clear waters and laid-back villages. We’ll soak up the island vibe, eat some local food, watch the sunset, and groove to tropical tunes at a beach bar under the stars.

Isla Holbox Boat Tour - Today, we’re diving (literally) into the wonders of Isla Holbox with a boat tour. On the lookout for those Instagram-worthy pink flamingos (seasonal). The afternoon is yours to snag a hammock, perhaps finally read that book you’ve been lugging around. Sea, chill, repeat – it’s the ultimate day to unwind and disconnect. Tonight, we'll enjoy an included BBQ dinner on the beach.

Playa del Carmen - This morning our Mexican escapade takes us back into the Yucatán. We’ll settle into our last hotel in Playa del Carmen with ample time to soak up all the beaches, bars, and tacos this renowned hotspot has to offer. Anyone up for souvenir hunting?

Chichén Itzá & Cenotes - Today, we’re off to check out one of the New 7 Wonders of the World - Chichén Itzá. With a local guide leading the way, we’ll uncover the cool myths and awesome sights of these ancient ruins, like the iconic Temple of Kukulkan (or ‘El Castillo’), the spooky Platform of the Skulls, and the huge Plaza of a Thousand Columns. Then, get ready to dive into the crystal-clear waters of a stunning cenote, a super cool natural swimming spot hidden in an underground world. *You'll likely join forces with our Central America group from today onwards for the rest of your Viva Mexico tour.

Tulum Ruins & Beaches - Heading out this morning, we're on our way to check out the amazing Tulum. We'll have the option to explore the archaeological Tulum ruins (optional activity) or hit the crystal-clear waters of Tulum beach. Back in Playa, it's time for our final group dinner and drinks. Let's dig into some avocado, knock back a tequila shot (or two), and have a blast with our new friends.

Check Out & Onward Travel - Time to say adios as our Mexican adventure comes to an end. You can check out to head back home, stay on in Playa Del Carmen or continue your travels. We’ll be on hand to help with planning any onwards travel.

tourName: Cancun whale shark holiday, Mexico
generalInfo:
Best nature encounters ever experience by the most famous BBC filmers. This has been said repeated times by the most adventurous persons exploring the world so what are you waiting for? Come, explore and learn with us about the Unique whale sharks, the biggest fish in the world. Mexico and the Yucatan and Cancun is known in recent years to have the biggest population of whale sharks in the world and we have been running this tip for over 20 years.

Our guides are very professional and provide environmental interpretation in this great trip. Besides the whale sharks we can eventually see with luck beautiful sea creatures: dolphins, manta rays, marine turtles and flying fish and even more! After a nice dive in the sea and a visit to the whale sharks, a delicious Mexican lunch is provided. You might even want to go for a swim in the blue water! Everything is possible on this magical tour!

A little fact about the whale sharks:

An average whale shark is about 8 meters, but can grow up to 15 meters long!! They have a wide flat head and has up to 3000 mini teeth. But don’t be afraid! They will not eat you! Despite having so many teeth, their esophagus is the size of a plum! So, no chance for them to eat you. Another reason why they would not eat you, is because they rather eat some nice plankton. Yes, the whale shark is vegetarian.
The don’t often come up high in the water. They often swim just below the water level and seem to prefer water that has a surface temperature of between 21 and 25 degrees.

Maybe you think that the whale shark is comparable with the white shark, but even the opposite! Compared to other sharks, they swim very slowly. No faster than about 5 km per hour. This allows us to swim together with this beautiful animal, whale sharks are very calm and not dangerous. They are our friends!!

tourName: Chihuahua & Baja vacation in Mexico
generalInfo: This program takes you from the historic city of Chihuahua to the coast of the Sea of Cortez in La Paz, offering a perfect balance of culture, adventure, and nature. Begin by exploring Chihuahua's colonial architecture and museums, followed by a visit to a Mennonite community and the stunning landscapes of the Sierra Tarahumara in Creel. Then, enjoy exciting activities in the Copper Canyon, including ziplining and scenic hikes. The journey continues on the iconic Chepe Express to El Fuerte, followed by a relaxing ferry crossing to La Paz. In the capital of Baja California Sur, you'll have free time to discover pristine beaches, take historical city tours, and enjoy unique excursions such as swimming with sea lions on Espiritu Santo Island or watching gray whales in season. A comprehensive experience that combines traditions, stunning landscapes, and marine life in one of Mexico's most beautiful destinations.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to the Sierra Tarahumara! Arrival at Chihuahua Airport, greeting and transfer to the colonial city of Chihuahua. At approximately 3:00 PM, we will have a guided city tour visiting the cathedral, government palace, Pancho Villa Museum, and Quinta Gameros. At the end of the tour, our guide will take us back to the hotel. Overnight stay in Chihuahua. Included: • Transfer from Chihuahua airport to hotel • City tour • Accommodation in Chihuahua

After breakfast at the hotel, we continue our journey to Creel with our luggage. On the way, we will visit the Mennonite Community, where you will learn about their history, culture, and way of life. You'll also have the opportunity to taste their famous Mennonite cheeses and visit their shops, workshops, and bakeries. After the visit, we continue to Creel, with a guided tour of the Valley of the Frogs, the Mushroom Valley, Lake Arareco, the San Ignacio Mission, and a Tarahumara cave. At the end of the tour, transfer to the hotel and overnight stay in Creel. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Transfer from Chihuahua to Creel •Visit to the Mennonite community •Visit to the Valley of the Frogs •Accommodation in Creel

After breakfast at the hotel, we head to Copper Canyons with our luggage. We'll have a guided tour to the "Piedra Volada" viewpoint, the Divisadero market, and the Copper Canyon National Park. Optional activities include a scenic 2.8 km cable car ride, the Via Ferrata rock climbing and rappelling circuit, the 2.5 km Zip Rider, or a 7-zipline system with sections ranging from 300 to 1,400 meters and heights up to 450 meters, including 7 jumps and 2 suspension bridges. Return via cable car to the starting point. (Activities not included.) Lunch and dinner are included at the hotel. Free afternoon to explore. Overnight stay in Copper Canyons. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel • Transfer from Creel to Copper Canyon • Admission to the adventure park in the canyon • Lunch and dinner at the hotel • Accommodation in Copper Canyon

After breakfast, we travel to the town of El Fuerte with our luggage, enjoying an incredible journey aboard the Chepe Express Train in Tourist Class (upgrades to First Class available). Upon arrival in El Fuerte, transfer to the hotel. Optional afternoon walk through the town square, city hall, museum, and riverside promenade. Overnight stay in El Fuerte. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Transfer from the hotel to the Chepe Express train station •Chepe Express train ticket in tourist class •Transfer from the El Fuerte train station to the hotel •Accommodation in El Fuerte

After breakfast, we will travel about 2.5 hours to Los Mochis. From there, we’ll board a ferry in Tourist Class, with an approximate travel time of 8 hours. If desired, a cabin upgrade is available (subject to availability). Overnight aboard the ferry from Topolobampo, Sinaloa to Pichilingue, Baja California Sur. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Transfer from the hotel in El Fuerte to the port in Los Mochis •Ferry ticket from Los Mochis to La Paz in cabin •Overnight on board the ferry

Arrival at the port of La Paz and transfer to the hotel. Free day to explore La Paz, a sustainable destination with semi-virgin beaches, dramatic desert-sea landscapes, and natural encounters such as sea lions, turtles, and dolphins. We recommend a sunset walk along the Malecón. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: •Transfer from the port to the hotel in La Paz •Accommodation in La Paz

Today is a free day to continue exploring the Sea of Cortez. We suggest a historical tour of downtown La Paz, including the Old City Hall, Juárez Theater, Velasco Garden, Our Lady of Peace Cathedral, the Regional Museum, and the Sudcalifornian Handicrafts Center, featuring local artisan goods made from regional materials like cholla, damiana, and seashells. We’ll then head to Balandra Beach, a Protected Natural Area, famous for its mushroom-shaped rock and crystal-clear shallow waters. Don’t forget your swimsuit! Afterward, we’ll visit El Tecolote Beach for lunch at a beachfront restaurant and some leisure time. Return to La Paz. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Accommodation in La Paz

Today we embark on one of the most beautiful excursions in La Paz. You’ll snorkel and swim with sea lions in their natural habitat, see colorful fish, birds, coral reefs, rock formations, and paradise-like beaches. Espíritu Santo Island, just 33 km from La Paz Bay, is part of a protected natural reserve and a biosphere reserve since 1995, home to 32 reptile species, 98 birds, 16 endemic species, and about 350 sea lions. We will visit Ensenada Grande Beach to relax and enjoy a lunch of fish ceviche with crackers and tostadas, ham and cheese sandwiches, soft drinks, and water. Return to the hotel. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: •Accommodation in La Paz • Breakfast at the hotel • Transportation from your hotel • Panga boat ride with shade and restroom • Sea lion watching • Snorkeling with sea lions (not available in June, July, and August) • Visit to Ensenada Grande Beach • Lunch: Fish ceviche and ham and cheese sandwiches • Drinks: Water and soft drinks • Life jacket and snorkeling equipment • Access to the Protected Natural Area • Guide

Free day in La Paz. Suggested activity: Seasonal Whale Watching (January 15 to March 15). Early morning pick-up from the hotel, then travel by road north across the peninsula to Bahía Magdalena. There, we’ll board a boat (panga) for a 2-hour whale-watching experience. You’ll see the gray whale, which can grow up to 16 meters and weigh 35 tons. Their migration from the Arctic to Baja California Sur is one of the longest for any mammal (16,000 km round trip). After the tour, we’ll enjoy lunch at a local restaurant and return to La Paz. Overnight stay in La Paz. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Accommodation in La Paz

Free day. At the scheduled time, our transfer service will pick you up at the hotel and take you to La Paz Airport for your departure flight. We wish you a safe and pleasant journey. Thank you for choosing us for your trip to Mexico—it was a pleasure to have you with us, and we hope you had an unforgettable experience exploring our beautiful country. Included: • Breakfast at the hotel •Transfer from the hotel in La Paz to the airport

tourName: Day of the Dead tour in Mexico
generalInfo: Immerse yourself in the vibrant culture and history of Mexico City in experience filled with traditional festivities, breathtaking architecture, and tantalising cuisine. This unforgettable journey will see you exploring ancient ruins, hiking scenic trails, and partaking in the magical celebrations of Día de los Muertos. From bustling markets to the serene beauty of its plazas, Mexico City offers a unique blend of the old and new, making it a destination of diverse and memorable experiences.

dayInfo.description: Mexico City, Mexico: Departure Time: 11:00 hr Duration: 5 days Mexico City Welcome Meeting & Walking Tour Bienvenidos! The day will start with a welcome meeting at your accommodation reception (please bring insurance details to share with your tour leader). Next go on a walking tour of the historic city center, where modernity meets ancient history - be sure to keep an eye out for any traditional day of the dead decorations! These lively streets are packed with beautiful architecture, chic and traditional restaurants, museums, and street food. Visit the famous Zocalo, the city’s huge central plaza to see the ancient Aztec ruins of Templo Mayor and the stunning Spanish architecture of the Metropolitan Cathedral. Walk past the beautiful Bellas Artes art museum, a masterpiece of Art Deco architecture and stop at the famous and exotic Mercado San Juan, where they sell everything from Spanish tapas to edible insects. Treat yourself to lunch with both traditional and adventurous options--ostrich burger, anyone? (lunch not included.) Overnight in Mexico City.

Mexico City-Tepotztlan-Mexico City, Mexico: Tepoztlan Temple Hike & Visit to Traditional Altars Today we will depart Mexico City in the morning (around 08:00hrs) and travel to the charming “magic town” (or “pueblo magico”) of Tepoztlan to explore the town and the nearby Aztec ruins with a local guide. Considered the birthplace of the Mesoamerican God Quetzalcoatl, this town is an important indigenous site and many people feel that it still holds a spiritual sacred energy, drawing many artists and mystics. The town is surrounded by majestic soaring cliffs and the stunning ruins are located at the top of one of these high-altitude lookouts. The hike to the top (about 1 hour) is very steep and can be quite challenging at this high altitude. But for adventurers, this hike is definitely well worth it. If you don’t feel up to it, you’re welcome to continue to explore this lovely town and its lively marketplace.You will also get to see the traditional altars that are central to the vibrant Day of the Dead festivities.
