Here you’ll forge bonds with the fellow adventurers who will accompany you on this riveting escapade. As the day unfolds, let the ivory sands of Cancun's famous shorelines be your canvas of relaxation or adventure; a medley of sunbathing, ocean dips, and exhilarating water sports are at your beck and call. Whether it’s harnessing the waves with a surfboard or gliding over the azure under a parasailing canopy, there's no shortage of aqua thrills. As dusk paints the sky in hues of fiery oranges and soothing purples, heighten your senses with the aromatic and spicy flavours that dance on the local cuisine. Street-side tacos bustling with authenticity, seafood freshly-caught and perfectly seasoned, all await to indulge your taste buds. Embark on a nocturnal exploration of Cancun's electric nightlife next. Feel the pulse of the beach front clubs, relax with artisan cocktails atop a chic rooftop bar, or, if you fancy, hop between watering holes with a boisterous pub crawl. Let loose to the rhythmic beats that define the Caribbean nights before resting up at your hotel, energized for the adventures that await. Note: Cancun dorm accommodations host a maximum of 8 guests.

Isla Holbox Serenity: Sands, Seas, and Unspoiled Scenes: As dawn ushers in a new day, you’re whisked away from the bustle of Cancun to the serene sanctuary of Isla Holbox. Your senses will come alive as the ferry glides across aquamarine waters towards this idyllic retreat, untouched by the rush of modern life, since vehicles are softly hummed out in this car-free oasis. Stepping onto Holbox, you'll find yourself enveloped in tranquillity, where the sands are like fine powder and the waters as clear as crystal. Here, life moves at a leisurely pace. Spend the day as you wish, perhaps lounging on sun-kissed beaches, letting the gentle ocean lap at your feet, or partaking in the simple joy of a hammock-swaying nap. Should adventure beckon, seize the opportunity for an optional island-hopping boat trip. This excursion promises a ballet of natural delights as you skirt between the picturesque isles of Bird Island, Eye Of The Water, and Passion Island. You'll encounter a tapestry of avian life, nestled amongst mangroves, and snorkel in sheltered lagoons awash with marine vibrancy. As daylight begins to wane, capture the essence of Holbox with a sunset boat expedition. On this optional cruise, the sinking sun casts a warm glow, igniting the sky and gilding the water—a spectacle of colour and light that etch everlasting memories. Nightfall on the island is subtle yet profound, where stars twinkle uninterrupted by city lights, allowing for a night of peaceful reflection and rest, lulling you into a deep sleep to the soothing lap of waves, as you cosy up in accommodation adding to the island's charm. Note: Dorm accommodations in Isla Holbox have a capacity of up to 6 guests.

Nature’s Canvas: Holbox’s Untouched Wonders: With a new day dawning in Isla Holbox, the symphony of waves serenades you towards another day of adventure in this eco-paradise. Begin with an invigorating beach hike, tracing the soft, white sands that form the island's perimeter; every step unfolds a new scene, framing the untouched beauty that has become the hallmark of Isla Holbox. As the sun climbs, prepare for a snorkelling adventure that delves beneath the island’s glistening surface. Gear up and immerse yourself into the underwater wonderland where vibrant coral gardens flourish. Drift amongst schools of tropical fish and perhaps chance upon a peacefully gliding sea turtle or other captivating marine life. The exploration matures into a delectably laid-back affair with a beach picnic. Breathe in the salty air as you dine al fresco, savouring a meal comprising the freshest ingredients and local delights, reflecting the island’s traditional taste and charm. As daylight closes its curtains, the unassuming character of Holbox's night sky becomes a canvas for stargazing. Here, you become familiar with constellations new and old, in a scene where the galaxy seems almost within reach. The serene closure to a day steeped in nature ensures a restful night's sleep, where the lullaby of the waves whispers through your Holbox dreams. Note: Continuation of the 6 guest maximum dorm accommodation in Isla Holbox.

Cenote Wonders: Mérida's Subterranean Ballet: Wave farewell to Isla Holbox’s carefree bliss as you journey towards Mérida, the cultural capital of Yucatán, awash with colonial splendour and ancestral echoes. But before the cityscape unfolds, you’re set for a subterranean escapade that defines this part of the world. Your destination is a cenote complex nestled amidst the Yucatán jungle, a spectacular interlude to today’s itinerary. Within these limestone formations, embrace an awe-inspiring trifecta of cenotes: the enveloping mystery of an enclosed cenote, the ethereal demi-open, and the celestial expanse of an open-air pool. Each cenote promises an azure plunge into waters so pure, they are believed to be sacred. Coupled with a biking adventure that threads between these liquid jewels, it's an exhilarating commune with nature that captivates both the eye and the spirit. As daylight casts its dying embers, you transfer to the heart of Mérida. Here, allow yourself to be intoxicated by the flavours and aromas of Yucatecan cuisine – a feast to be remembered. Whether it's the tangy zest of cochinita pibil or the delicate texture of papadzules, the traditional dishes are replete with centuries of heritage and taste that are sure to satisfy. Retreat to your cosy accommodations in Mérida, enriched by the day's explorations and tasteful encounters. As night encroaches, surrender to rest, buoyed by the anticipation of more adventure and within the embrace of a city echoing with stories and dreams. Note: Mérida dorm accommodations welcome up to 8 guests.

Mérida's Cultural Mosaic: Flamingos, Mayan Legacy, or Market Delights: Rise and shine in the bustling heart of Yucatán, ready to tailor this day to your curiosities. Mérida serves not just as a historical hotspot but as a springboard to the region's diverse attractions, allowing you to personalize your journey. Should the siren call of nature beckon, set out for Celestun, a biosphere reserve of pristine waters and mangroves that's home to legions of flamboyant pink flamingos. Watching these majestic birds in their natural habitat is a ballet of colour and grace, creating a serene sojourn that’s both visually stunning and humbling. If it’s the whispers of the past that intrigue you, a journey to the ancient Mayan city of Uxmal awaits. As a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it showcases the artistic genius of the Mayans with its magnificent pyramids, grand palaces, and ingenious sculptures. Tread through history, feeling the vibrancy of a civilization etched in stone. Alternatively, delve into the bustling local markets of Mérida with a food-centric guided tour. Here, every sense is engaged as you navigate through stalls bursting with fresh produce, artisanal wares, and the cacophony of vendors and buyers. Taste exotic fruits and spices, and sample authentic dishes, crafting an edible narrative that will leave you satiated in every way. Whichever path you choose, it unfolds against Mérida's historic backdrop, ensuring a day of exploration and enchantment. Return to your accommodations, rich with the day's experiences, and let the warmth of Mérida’s twilight soothe you into a peaceful night's rest. Note: Mérida dorm accommodations welcome up to 8 guests.

Chichen-Itza's Timeless Majesty and Valladolid's Local Charms: As the first light seeps through your window in Mérida, excitement bubbles within at the prospect of traversing grounds once ruled by a powerful civilization. Today, you’re poised to encounter Chichen-Itza, one of the most illustrious Mayan cities known to the modern world. En route, the Yucatán landscape provides a verdant backdrop before the iconic pyramids of Chichen-Itza cut a stark silhouette against the sky. Your exploration here is without a guide, allowing you to absorb the monumental Kukulkan Pyramid, the grandiose Temple of Warriors, and the mystic Great Ballcourt at your own pace, with your travel leader on hand to share historical insights. Take a moment to marvel at the precision of Mayan architecture and the complexity of their astronomical understanding – elements that time has preserved within these stone canvases. With history etched into your soul, Valladolid is your next canvas - a picturesque colonial town where history pervades the streets and vibrant local life flows freely. A highlight here is the cantina experience, a slice of pure Mexican hospitality. Revel in the joyous strains of live music, sample indigenous beverages like mezcal and tequila, and immerse in the local tapestry as you interact with Valladolid's welcoming inhabitants. After an exhilarating and enriching day, settle into your overnight lodgings in Valladolid, where the comforting echoes of the town's charm and the day's encounters lull you into restful contemplation and anticipatory dreams of tomorrow’s adventure. Note: Valladolid accommodations cater to a more intimate setting, with a dorm capacity of 2 or 3 guests.

Authentic Encounters: Ek Balam's Living Heritage: Your journey today leads you from Valladolid to the verdant embrace of the Yucatán Peninsula, where the soul of Mayan tradition beats strong in the community of Ek Balam. Prepare yourself for an immersive day, which not only bridges centuries of culture but connects you deeply with local life. As part of your authentic experience, witness the delicate art of hammock weaving, a skill passed down through generations. You'll also try your hand at sewing and tortilla making, turning corn into the staple that forms the backbone of Yucatecan cuisine. Each activity is more than a skill—it's a story, a cherished chapter in the legacy of Ek Balam, shared with and taught to you by artisans who are custodians of their culture. Your journey continues below ground into the realm of the cenote XCanché. Here, swim in waters that glitter with clarity, encased by ancient stalactites and stalagmites which have silently stood for eons. The cool waters provide a natural respite and a moment of reflection on the wonders of the natural world. Emerging from the cenote, the day is not yet done. Visit the nearby archaeological site of Ek Balam, where the ruins rise dramatically against the landscape. Behold the Acropolis, striking in its size and detail, and ascend to its pinnacle for a panoramic vista that lays the jungle's endless green carpet before you. Tonight, rest is not within the confines of a hotel, but amongst the community that has welcomed you with open arms. In the communal cabanas of Ek Balam, you will find a sense of connection and warmth, sleeping under the same stars that have been witnesses to this land's millennia-spanning narrative. Note: Ek Balam offers a comfortable communal stay with dorm capacities up to 2 or 3 guests.

Tulum's Coastal Charm: Ancient Ruins and Natural Splendour: As dawn breaks, you bid farewell to the heartfelt hospitality of Ek Balam's community and pivot towards the coastal allure of Tulum. This seaside town merges Caribbean tranquillity with historical intrigue, offering a palette of activities that cater to the soul of every traveller. In Tulum, the beaches beckon with their resplendent white sands and the inviting embrace of the turquoise sea. A day at leisure here could mean hours spent sunbathing, swimming, or simply absorbing the splendour of the coastline. Beyond the beach’s bliss, step back in time as you discover the archaeological site of Tulum. An ancient fortress city, it perches dramatically atop a cliff, presiding over the Caribbean's ceaseless waves. Amble among the temple ruins and palatial remnants, reflecting on the Mayan civilization that thrived here against a backdrop of breathtaking ocean views. For a subaquatic adventure, Tulum’s cenotes provide a refreshing escape. Plunge into these natural sinkholes to explore an underwater realm of limestone formations and hidden grottos—a diver’s and snorkeller’s paradise. Moreover, today presents an opportunity to leave a positive footprint through eco-friendly or social volunteering. You could participate in beach clean-ups to preserve the natural beauty or assist in educational programmes for Maya children, fostering community engagement and cultural exchange. As the sun sets on a day replete with natural beauty and human connection, find solace in Tulum's accommodating embrace, where a restful night's sleep prepares you for the final chapter of this Yucatán journey. Note: Accommodations in Tulum provide an intimate dorm setting for 2 or 3 guests.

Final Day in Tulum: Reflection and Relaxation: As the Yucatán sun rises to bless the land with its golden hues, breathe in the laid-back essence of Tulum for one final day. This coastal gem, renowned for balancing the vibrancy of Mexican culture with the calm repose of its shores, presents you with numerous ways to craft the closing of your expedition. Perhaps you'll choose to immerse yourself once more in the gentle laps of the ocean, contemplating the memories etched into every day you've spent on this journey. The serene environment here is perfect for introspection and relaxation, allowing the soothing sounds and sensations of the sea to amplify your reflection. If your appetite for exploration still yearns for sustenance, consider embarking on one last trek to unearth hidden aspects of Tulum. Wander through the green curtain of the tropical foliage on trails dotted around the area or perhaps visit bustling local craft markets for mementoes that capture the spirit of this land. For those who wish to simply celebrate the gravity of what they've experienced, bask in the warmth of the coastal breeze or indulge in a farewell toast at a beach front cabana, relishing the camaraderie forged along Yucatán's ancient and modern corridors. As night descends, huddle around a bonfire with your companions to exchange stories and laugh over shared memories, solidifying the bonds that will linger long after your return home. In Tulum's enveloping night, under a tapestry of stars, lay to rest one final time as the ocean’s rhythm harmonizes with your heartbeats, softly serenading you to sleep. Note: Accommodations in Tulum provide an intimate dorm setting for 2 or 3 guests.

Adiós Tulum: Homeward Trails from Cancun: Awaken to the gentle caress of Tulum’s sea breeze on your final morning, as the echoes of an unforgettable excursion reverberate in your mind. The vivid memories of sunlit ruins, the laughter shared in the cenote's cool embrace, and the flavours of rich Yucatán cuisine linger with you as you pack your bags, imbued with a newfound appreciation for this sun-drenched land. As you leave Tulum behind, the scenic route to Cancún unfolds before you – an opportunity to gaze one final time at the landscapes which have been your home these past days. The journey, an interlude for contemplation, allows you to muse over the connections made, both human and historic, with the beauty of Yucatán imprinted on your soul. Your arrival in Cancún signifies the end of this chapter, but the beginning of a lifetime of cherished recollections. You’ll navigate the familiar space of Cancún's vibrancy, now juxtaposed with the depth of experience collected along the way. Here ends your curated odyssey, one that has taken you through the heartbeats of culture, nature’s purest expressions, and the warmest encounters of community life. With your departure imminent, the rhythm of Mexico's coastal heartbeat fades into the distance as you board your homeward flight. As the wheels lift off the tarmac and Yucatán becomes a patchwork below, you’re secure in the knowledge that though this journey ends, the stories of the land, its people, and your adventures therein will retain their vivid colours, an indelible part of your traveller's soul.

tourName: Yucatan holiday in Mexico, tailormade
generalInfo:
This immersive 9-day, 8-night itinerary is a perfect blend of white-sand relaxation, mystical underwater exploration, and profound cultural history. You will experience the vibrant resorts of the Riviera Maya, the tranquil barefoot luxury of a car-free island, and the rich colonial heritage of the inland Yucatán. This journey is special because it connects you with the region's natural wonders, from the glowing waters of a bioluminescent lagoon to the pristine ecosystems of a UNESCO World Heritage site, while ensuring deep dives into Mayan history at world-famous archaeological sites.

This holiday is designed for the traveler who wants more than just a beach vacation. It's a journey of natural and historical discovery, highlighted by unique experiences:

Island Magic: Spend two nights on Isla Holbox, a laid-back, car-free island escape known for its sandy streets and breathtaking natural beauty.

Mystical Night Adventure: Experience the wonder of the Yucatán with a Bioluminescence Tour in Kayak. You'll glide silently toward Punta Mosquito under the stars and then swim in the dark waters as tiny organisms illuminate with every movement, creating a magical, unforgettable spectacle.

The Mayan Underworld (Cenotes): Dedicate two full days to exploring the region's sacred sinkholes. On the All-inclusive Cenotes tour, you'll ride a unique vintage truck to three different cenotes (NOOL HA, Suytun, and Chukum) for refreshing swims and to marvel at dramatic cave formations

Ancient Grandeur: Visit the iconic UNESCO World Heritage site of Chichén Itzá, home of the massive Kukulkan pyramid, and explore other structures like the observatory and the sacred cenote.

Sustainable Ecosystems: Explore the protected Sian Ka'an Biosphere Reserve on a tour focused on sustainable practices by a Mayan cooperative. You'll boat through four interconnected lagoons and ancient Mayan canals, visit the ancient temple of Xlapak, and float peacefully down a scenic channel surrounded by mangroves.

dayInfo.description: Your Mexican adventure begins with a seamless transfer from the airport to the stunning Caribbean coast and your accommodation in Playa del Carmen. This town has established itself as one of the region's finest resorts, offering a perfect blend of white sands, upmarket boutiques, trendy restaurants, and access to magnificent cenotes. Settle in, feel the Caribbean breeze, and prepare to explore this vibrant destination.

Today is completely at leisure. You have time to enjoy the atmosphere of Playa del Carmen, which offers a more tranquil and authentic vibe compared with neighboring Cancun. Relax on the stunning white sands , shop for souvenirs, or dine at a beachfront cafe. This is the perfect day to dive into a nearby local cenote, sampling the magical underwater world before heading to your next destination.

Trade the bustle of the Riviera Maya for the tranquil, barefoot luxury of Isla Holbox. After a private morning transfer to the port of Chiquila , you’ll take a short, scenic ferry ride to this magical island. Holbox is renowned as an ideal spot for an adult-only holiday. Settle into your charming accommodation, explore the sandy streets, and prepare for an evening of island life and spectacular nature.

Enjoy a day of pure island bliss. Holbox is perfect for relaxing or exploring at your own pace. The true magic, however, awaits after sunset with an extraordinary Bioluminescence Tour in Kayak. As you glide silently beneath a canopy of twinkling stars, you’ll paddle toward the breathtaking Punta Mosquito. The pinnacle of the night is when you delve into the water to swim amidst a spectacular display of bioluminescence, where glowing aquatic creatures light up your surroundings with every movement, creating an unforgettable, mystical realm.

Take an early morning ferry back to the mainland at Chiquila and board a private shuttle, trading coastal life for the Yucatán's colonial heartland. Arrive in Valladolid, a city characterized by its colourful colonial buildings and bustling main square. Settle into your accommodation and spend the afternoon soaking up the rich culture, meander in the Plaza e Parque Francisco Canton, marvel at historic churches, and enjoy authentic street food, doing as the locals do.

Rise early for the must-do Chichén Itzá + 2 Cenotes tour. Your early departure ensures you arrive at the UNESCO-listed Mayan ruins at a good time to avoid long lines , allowing you to experience the iconic Kukulkan pyramid, the observatory, and the sacred cenote in relative peace. Next, embark on a fascinating adventure into the Mayan underworld to discover two impressive cenotes. You'll swim in the crystal-clear waters, marvelling at the natural beauty that surrounds you in these sacred, ancient wonders.

The day begins with an exhilarating All-inclusive Cenotes tour. You'll ride aboard the only vintage truck in the Yucatán Peninsula, cruising through lush landscapes in comfort and style. You’ll visit three spectacular cenotes: the hidden gem of NOOL HA, the famed Suytun Cenote with its dramatic circular vault, and Hacienda Chukum, which provides a magical setting for exploration. Afterward, take a private shuttle transfer to Tulum, a resort renowned for its bohemian atmosphere, chic restaurants, and rich Mayan history.

This morning, participate in the extraordinary Sian Ka'an Reserve Ancient Maya Canals Tour , nestled within a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Your experience begins with a delightful breakfast of traditional Mayan cuisine. The tour then follows a historic Mayan waterway through four significant lagoons. You’ll witness incredible aquatic birdlife and visit the ancient Mayan temple of Xlapak. The most unique part: you'll leap from the dock to float peacefully for 30 to 45 minutes along a scenic 950-meter canal, surrounded by orchids, bromeliads, and mangroves. The unforgettable day concludes with a delicious, traditional lunch.

Your incredible journey through the Yucatán comes to an end today. You will take a very early morning shared standard shuttle from Tulum to Cancun Airport (CUN) for your departure, carrying memories of Mexico's most majestic highlights and hidden wonders.

tourName: Yucatan self drive holiday in Mexico
generalInfo:
Discover the Yucatán through a thoughtful and enriching experience that combines cultural exploration, nature, and human connection. You'll visit the archaeological site of Ek Balam, a remarkably well-preserved location that remains relatively untouched by mass tourism, offering a glimpse into the legacy of the ancient Maya civilization.

The journey continues into a local community, where you’ll be warmly welcomed. You’ll take part in a traditional craft workshop—creating a bracelet or dreamcatcher—while learning about the cultural practices and the ongoing efforts to preserve them.

Along the way, you’ll hear Mayan legends, gain insight into the region’s native plants, and meet the Melipona bees—an important species in Mayan tradition known for their ecological significance and ceremonial value.

This experience is designed for travelers looking for authentic, respectful engagement with local cultures and environments—ideal for those who value learning and meaningful encounters over fast-paced tourism.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to the Yucatan Peninsula! Arrival at Cancun International Airport, gateway to the Mexican Caribbean famous for its beautiful beaches and natural environment, with jungle and cenotes. Home of the Mayan culture, with its magnificent archaeological sites and living Mayan communities. You will go to the car rental office where you will be given the car you previously hired. Once you have the keys, let the adventure to your next destination begin : Puerto Morelos ! Included Time and unlimited mileage of the car, taxes and fees, ALI: Insurance against damages to third parties for $ 700,000 mexican pesos, LDW: Insurance against damages to the car with 0% deductible, TP: Insurance against theft of the car with 0% deductible, B2B: Insurance against damages to windows, mirrors, windshields, rims and tires, RA: Roadside Assistance (roadside assistance) 24 hours in case of breakdown or accident by the insurance company and additional driver (under previous reservation). ESim Card

Today, you will join a group of travelers in Puerto Morelos where your English-speaking guide will be waiting for you and accompany you on a 2-hour tour to the Puerto Morelos Reef National Park, this park is the second largest in the world, has been declared a protected area and is one of the best preserved reefs in Mexico, established in 1998, is part of the Mesoamerican Barrier Reef System. First you will be provided with the necessary equipment for the activity (vest, fins, mask and snorkel), then you will approach the coral reef, where thanks to the clear and low water of the area you will be able to observe species of corals, fish, crustaceans and sea grasses of the reef lagoon, along the tour you will also have the chance to find sea turtles. Afterwards you will return to the dock located a few minutes away from the reef and finally you will be able to return to your hotel. Included Breakfast at the hotel Boat, guide, snorkel equipment ( life jacket, fins, viewfinder), water and CONANP bracelet.

Today, take the road to Valladolid. Valladolid is a small city in Yucatán known for its colonial architecture and rich cultural history. One of Valladolid's main attractions is its beautiful historic center, filled with cobblestone streets, brightly colored colonial houses and historic buildings. The city has a wealth of churches, plazas and museums that are a reflection of its rich history and culture. It is also known for its local gastronomy, which is a mix of Mayan and Spanish cuisine as well as its nearby cenotes that are perfect for swimming and exploring. It is a recommended stop for travelers visiting Yucatán who wish to immerse themselves in Mexican culture. Included Breakfast at the hotel

Today, set off to explore two cultural gems of the Yucatán Peninsula. Your day begins with a visit to the archaeological site of Ek Balam, meaning Black Jaguar in Mayan. Still relatively quiet and nestled in the jungle, this ancient city stands out for its impressive structures, including defensive walls, a ball court, and its remarkable Acropolis, which you can climb for breathtaking views of the surrounding forest. Your English-speaking guide will walk you through the site, sharing stories of kings, astronomers, and sacred rituals. In the afternoon, head to the nearby Maya community of Yalcobá for a meaningful cultural immersion. You'll join a traditional handicraft workshop, creating your own bracelet or dreamcatcher alongside a local family while learning about their efforts to preserve their heritage. You’ll also explore the local flora, hear stories about Mayan legends and forest spirits, and learn about Melipona bees, revered in Maya culture for their honey and ecological importance. A day filled with history, connection, and hands-on discovery in the heart of the Yucatán. Included Breakfast at the hotel Entrance fee to the AS of Ek Balam - For foreigners, Guide Supplies and lunch Full day local guide - SPA at Yalcoba Full day translation services at Yalcoba

Today, embark on a journey to discover the legacy of the ancient Maya civilization at Chichén Itzá, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World. Accompanied by your English-speaking local guide, you’ll explore the site's most iconic structures, including the Kukulcan Pyramid, the Temple of the Warriors, and the Observatory, while learning about the life, rituals, and beliefs of this remarkable culture. After the visit, head to the peaceful village of Yaxunah to unwind at the hidden gem of Cenote Lol-Ha. Surrounded by lush nature, you’ll enjoy a refreshing swim in its crystal-clear waters — the perfect way to end your day of exploration. Included Breakfast at the hotel INAH fee: Chichén Itzá AS - Foreigners Guide AAFY fee: Chichén Itzá AS - Foreigners Lunch in the community with mayan family Full day cultural promoter SPA Full day translation services

Today, leave Valladolid for Tulum. Tulum is a city located on the Caribbean coast of Quintana Roo, with a unique combination of natural beauty and rich cultural history. It offers visitors the opportunity to swim in the cenotes and relax on the beautiful beaches. You will find a relaxed and bohemian atmosphere, as the city is known for its hippie-chic lifestyle, with craft stores, bars and organic and vegan restaurants. The city also has a vibrant nightlife, with bars and nightclubs offering a wide variety of music and entertainment. Included Breakfast at the hotel

Enjoy a relaxing day at your own pace in the vibrant town of Tulum. Whether you prefer lounging on the beach, or exploring the boho-chic shops and cafés. You might also choose to swim in one of the nearby cenotes or treat yourself to a wellness activity like a yoga session or spa treatment. Tulum offers a perfect mix of nature, culture, and relaxation—ideal for unwinding or exploring independently. Included Breakfast at the hotel

Today, explore Tulum, one of Mexico's most iconic archaeological sites, declared a UNESCO World Heritage site. Together with your English-speaking local guide, you will take a guided tour of approximately 45 minutes to learn why these ruins played a particularly important role in the maritime and overland trade of the Mayan region, as well as serving as an astronomical observatory and defensive system. You will be able to observe the various buildings and murals, including El Castillo, the tallest structure in Tulum. This Mayan city is situated amidst a mangrove ecosystem and atop a cliff overlooking the beautiful Caribbean Sea, making it a unique and spectacular location. From the archaeological site, you will have access to the Playa Ruinas beach. Don't hesitate to take a swim and cool off. Included Breakfast at the hotel INAH fee to the AS of Tulum - For foreigners Guide Jaguar Park in Tulum for foreigners

Enjoy your last day in Tulum to relax and soak in the peaceful Caribbean vibes. Whether you choose to unwind on the beach, explore the local shops and cafés of the pueblo, or take one last swim in a nearby cenote, make the most of this final moment in paradise before your journey continues. Included Breakfast at the hotel

Depending on your flight time, make your way to the airport to drop off your rental car. We hope this journey was filled with unforgettable memories — safe travels and see you soon for your next adventure! Included Breakfast at the hotel
